fuchsia-trailing-return.description:
Description

Functions that have trailing returns are disallowed, except for those using
decltype
specifiers and lambda with otherwise unutterable return types.

For example:

// No warning
int
add_one
(
const
int
arg
)
{
return
arg
;
}
// Warning
auto
get_add_one
()
->
int
(
*
)(
const
int
)
{
return
add_one
;
}

Exceptions are made for lambdas and
decltype
specifiers:

// No warning
auto
lambda
=
[](
double
x
,
double
y
)
->
double
{
return
x
+
y
;};
// No warning
template
<
typename
T1
,
typename
T2
>
auto
fn
(
const
T1
&
lhs
,
const
T2
&
rhs
)
->
decltype
(
lhs
+
rhs
)
{
return
lhs
+
rhs
;
}

See the features disallowed in Fuchsia at
https://fuchsia.dev/fuchsia-src/development/languages/c-cpp/cxx?hl=en
fuchsia-trailing-return.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
